instruction: What machine learning models were used in the investigation of pepper maturity recognition models using hyperspectral technology to improve economic benefits in pepper harvesting?
Output: The machine learning models used to improve economic benefits in pepper harvesting were the back propagation neural network (BP) and the kernel based extreme learning machine (KELM).

instruction: Can the use of hyperspectral technology in pepper maturity recognition models improve economic benefits by accurately identifying the maturity during harvesting and monitoring maturity?
Output: Yes, the use of hyperspectral technology in pepper maturity recognition models can improve economic benefits by accurately identifying the maturity during harvesting and monitoring maturity. The related paper investigated the use of hyperspectral data to train models such as back propagation neural network (BP) and kernel based extreme learning machine (KELM) models. These models were able to accurately recognize pepper maturity with high precision, with the KELM and PCA-KELM models achieving precision rates of 99.5% and 97.3% respectively. By accurately identifying the maturity of chili peppers, farmers can optimize their harvesting process and ensure that peppers are harvested at the right maturity level, which can lead to improved economic benefits. Additionally, the PCA-KELM model used only a fraction of the data compared to the KELM model, resulting in faster training speed and more efficient use of resources. Overall, the use of hyperspectral technology in pepper maturity recognition models offers an effective method to discriminate pepper ripeness and can contribute to improving economic benefits in the pepper industry.
